Reviews.Title: “Better than average Super 8”
Reviews.Author: 1ScubaDiver
Reviews.Content: Nothing special except they do have an airport shuttle. Next to Ellis Island, which has a restaurant which is considered one of the best DEALS in Vegas for their top sirloin special. Pretty good but nothing speial Booked with Orbitz and price was $21 less than if I had booked at the motel.

Reviews.Title: “Overcharged”
Reviews.Author: Marcee B
Reviews.Content: The carpets were dirty, bed was hard, coffee was good (No free continental breakfast), everyone was helpful but, lost half a day waiting on the manager, because he was saying we owed more money, we tried explaining to him that they already received the credit card payment.... but he kept insisting that we needed to pay more. I called my credit card company and it showed they received the full amount he was requesting. We even printed a bill online, but he still didnt acknowledge it. So i called the credit card services in front of him and he overheard me saying I wanted to dispute the charges.... Right there he called me over and said everything went through, and finally gave us a receipt. Which he wouldnt give us, when we paid at checking in. The manager probably thought he would get more money out of us since we are minorities.... So get your receipts and look over your credit card bills for overcharges.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: WestIndian4ever
Reviews.Content: Stayed here because of a flight change. The hotel was clean, staff was great, extremely helpful and courteous. Great value for money Right next door is a casino, restaurant and bar. it was an easy walk to the strip. A 15 minute walk to the corner of Ballys/Caesars

Reviews.Title: “Great for Park, Sleep, Fly”
Reviews.Author: BowlingGrandma2
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 1 night before our trip and 1 night after. We used their shuttle to and from the airport. We selected this hotel over others nearby that offer an airport shuttle because they have a 24 hour shuttle service. The hotel staff was very friendly and helpful. When I called after my trip for pick-up, the woman who answered gave me the best, easy to follow directions to the shuttle pick-up location that I have ever received. We had one of their larger rooms with frig before our trip and a standard room when we returned. Everything was clean, in working order, and the bed was comfortable in both rooms. The standard room is quite small but all we needed for 1 night. There is a small casino with restaurant right next door. We got sub sandwiches and took them to our room to eat. The casino is pretty smoky but the sandwiches were really good.

Reviews.Title: “Staff more than helpful!!”
Reviews.Author: Mich2too
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights, one at beginning of trip and one at end of trip in March 2012. Upon arrival in Vegas, my mom feel on the jetway and had to be seen in emergency room. Called motel and told them the situation and that we would probably not make it in to the motel until after midnight. Eight hours later, we finally get to motel to find that they have actually changed our reservation to the next day so that we could check in whenever we arrived and could actually not worry about checking out until we were ready to!!! Even though we be checking into our timeshare that same day and did not need to stay the whole time, it was SWEET!!!! They also gave us a room without any neighbors so that we could get some sleep. We were going on 26 hrs plus without sleep. The free internet made it possible for me to quickly locate mobility scooter rentals so that our 10 trip could still be saved. We returned after checking out of our timeshare as we were still in town for another day. We were assigned the exact same room as our first stay. We had our luggage delivered ahead of us, and they gals on duty took great care of them for us. Manager even escorted us to our room and helped get luggage to room. Not something that is "normal" at a location like this. Checked out the next morning. Left our luggage at the front desk and told them we would be back later that night to use the airport shuttle and drop off our scooters. NO PROBLEM!!! This is again NOT the typical for a motel like this. When we returned, discussed our pleasant experience with the manager, especially under the circumstances. This place really went above and beyond to assist us as much as possible. The one and only drawback was the shuttle driver who stated to me, "I don't want to be here". He then also delivered us to the wrong airline gates. Had to deal with 4 pieces of luggage and mother on crutches across 4 lanes of traffic and into some place where she could sit down and I could go get skycap. Highly recommend this motel. Is close to the strip without being out of the way either. Next door to Ellis Island which has really cheap red-eye meals.

Reviews.Title: “Decent price and close to everything, but not too close!”
Reviews.Author: Avistow
Reviews.Content: I arrived on Friday (Feb 24) and spent 2 nights here so far, this is my last night here... I'm here because of work and just wanted somewhere at a decent price... Well this is it! The staff here are friendly, there is lots of room for my truck, Internet is great as well as the flat screen TV... I've spent most of my time walking around while here in town, so it's nice to have a comfortable bed and not waking up with a sore back, so thanks for the comfortable mattress! My room was nice and clean all three days, and I didn't notice any smells in the halls, at least on the second floor in my area. I see from a previous post that a 1.5 million dollar renovation was done... I guess the bath tubs were not included, mine looks like someone took a pick axe to the bottom of the tub, and the seal must not be that great since there seems to be a bit of water on the floor once I'm done showering. Other than that one little "negative", I'd stay here again for sure!

Reviews.Title: “city trip”
Reviews.Author: FrankvdP
Reviews.Content: Good location, close to the Strip. Friendly people at the front desk. Not clean rooms and smelly hallways.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location & good place”
Reviews.Author: TheLush101
Reviews.Content: Stayed here as part of a pre-organised trip in January 2012 for 2 nights. If you've stayed at a Super 8 before, then you should know what you're getting. The place is in a great location, off the Strip so you don't have the traffic noise, lights and crowds but you can easily walk there in 10/15 minutes. I had a twin room (two double beds) on the ground floor (first floor if you're American). Check-in was quick - had a view of the car park but wasn't there for a view from my room! There was a wardrobe, flat screen TV (didn't check if it worked though), alarm clock and coffee making facilities. The sink was outside the bathroom (like a lot of US hotels) and had a tonne of freebies (free hair wax and toothpaste samples), plus the usual shower/body gel. There were plenty of towels and hot water and the bathroom had a shower over a bath and was a good size. The bathroom fixtures were a bit dated though but clean and functional. This Super 8 doesn't offer free breakfast like most do but does have free coffee available in the lobby (I loathe coffee so the smell was off-putting, but for the vast majority, this is a good thing!). The hotel's right next door to a casino that serves good food - had a breakfast there one morning, which was well priced and had the usual large American portions. There're also vending machines in the Super 8 for water and other drinks you might want. The free WiFi was a good speed and had a good signal in most areas. A few people have commented on the area this Super 8 is in - I didn't have any problem walking to the Strip and felt pretty safe walking back on my own as there was plenty of traffic going past and you could always get a taxi. Overall, would recommend staying here as it's a good base for seeing Vegas and you can get away from the bustle of the Strip, whilst still being close enough to enjoy it when you want to.

Reviews.Title: “For The Price, A Decent Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Nelson S
Reviews.Content: After being taken halfway around Vegas by some cabbie who didn't know where he was going, I finally arrived at the Super 8. There's nothing really impressive about this hotel, but that's not so bad. It's perfectly adequate in every way. The beds were comfortable. I got a flat screen TV in my room, that had maybe 25 channels. The air conditioner seemed to have a tough time keeping up, so I'm not sure about its effectiveness when it gets really hot. But it was fine for the duration of my stay. The bathroom was the worst part of the room. The upper corner of the shower wall was dirty and had cobwebs. For some reason, the sink was located outside of the room. They did leave lots of towels, and the free shampoo made me smell all pretty. The hotel does include wireless internet, but I wasn't really impressed with it. It was slow, but it did work all the time. The location is just off the Strip, 1 block east. I was able to walk to Bally's in 5 minutes, but I do walk pretty fast. 10 minutes should get you there, where you can enter in the side door (right by the big sign) and be a short walk away from the monorail. I know some people have complained about the sketchiness of the neighborhood, but I wasn't concerned. There is a 7-11 right next door, where I'd pick up a granola bar for breakfast, saving me a few bucks over a breakfast buffet. The Super 8 is attached to the Ellis Island Casino, which is a little ran down. I spent all of 10 minutes in there and just couldn't handle the smokiness anymore. It's definitely a place that attracts more of a blue collar crowd, so don't have high expectations for it. Overall, it was a pretty good place to stay. It's a solid value for all of $35 a night I paid. Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great location without spending $$$”
Reviews.Author: Denverite0509
Reviews.Content: My friends and I stayed here last May/June. We were on a camping road trip and Vegas was our halfway point, so we figured we'd stay in a hotel for one night instead of camp. Researching beforehand, we were worried because most hotels imposed a minimum check in age of 21, and we were all 19/20 at the time. Luckily we learned about this one on tripadvisor. Not only were we allowed to check in, but the rates were great--and the location! You're only a block off the strip. We walked there that night and while walking back was a little sketchy, it's Vegas...I really can't complain. Our check in/out were both smooth and the service very friendly. The room was clean and needed updating, but for the price, we were thrilled. I think we paid around $50 and it was midweek. There was some updating going on; it looked like it was just in the hallways but who knows. They have a couple washers and dryers which was perfect, since we didn't have to go to a laundromat to do our dirty camping washing. I believe they sold the soap at the front desk. Didn't get a look at the pool. I am returning to Vegas in a week (legal this time!) and seriously considered staying here (found a deal I liked better on the strip). Feel free to contact me with questions.

Reviews.Title: “Cheap. Only 35 a night. Clean and comfortable. Close to strip”
Reviews.Author: sjebuffetfan
Reviews.Content: If you want to save money, stay here. Close to the strip. About 6 blocks away. 15 minute walk It was clean and quiet. No issues. I would stay again. Free Wireless Internet

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: SparklesBournemouth
Reviews.Content: Have stayed with Super 8 several times as a result of this place, its clean, comfortable, plenty of room and value for money. It is off the strip, which means its quiet at night, bt also as a tourist you do have to be careful at night and just take cabs, but otherwise felt very safe here, no probs. Would stay here again

Reviews.Title: “Ordinary budget motel with big plus: free airport shuttle”
Reviews.Author: WebWanderer
Reviews.Content: Flying home from Las Vegas in late November, weather caused our flight to return -- getting back into L.V. airport at 10 pm; the airline gave us a list of hotels we could get a discount at. The Super 8 Las Vegas shuttle picked up a number of us stranded passengers, as well as a few of the flight crew, who told me they often stay there. Checking in at close to midnight, found the staff courteous and pleasant. Room was adequate, quiet, with surprisingly good coffee-maker! The free shuttle back to the airport in the a.m. was exactly on time.

Reviews.Title: “Clean place to crash.”
Reviews.Author: Pammyp00
Reviews.Content: Room was clean, service nice, and for being a block off the main part of the strip, the price is really good. Bummer that there was no continental breakfast but I imagine for most people on a trip to Vegas, that would be wasted so why do it. A 7Eleven and AM/PM are next door for a quick bite to eat and, of course, many good (and some very good) restaurants are within close proximity. Also, they take pets for a small fee. I think the only other place on the strip that does is the Flamingo which only takes dogs, not cats.

Reviews.Title: “Big Motel, Small Amenities”
Reviews.Author: Mike D
Reviews.Content: I found the room to be noisy and carpet dirty. The window drape would not close fully. The bed and bathroom was average for an older motel. The ice maker in the hall did not work, had to walk a considerable distance to near the loby for ice. I was disappointed to find this Super 8 offers no continental breakfast. Only a coffee machine. I understood all Super 8's offered continental breakfast. My mistake. It upset me that the person behind the counter was annoyed with a couple of questions I asked, re: directions. Cheap motel. I guess you get what you pay for. This one does not stand up to other Super 8 motels I have stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “definitely a budget motel”
Reviews.Author: Robert O
Reviews.Content: Our room was clean and the bed was comfortable. However this room was not very sound proof at all. Plenty of noise infiltrates from both the hallway and adjacent units. This is a well used motel. But the price was right and it is only a short walk to the strip and you don't spend much time in the motel room anyways.

Reviews.Title: “No complaints - Comfortable Clean and Inexpensive”
Reviews.Author: searchingshambhala
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out it was a good experience. Big clean room with a good shower. Front desk was helpful. They have an airport shuttle bus that leaves every hour on the half after 730 am. Free wifi. Inexpensive for the comfort level and proximity to the strip. Actually inexpensive regardless. $50 well spent.

Reviews.Title: “Great airport stop”
Reviews.Author: bogiebud
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this motel twice in the past year, for parkinging/flying purposed. Excellent value and ease of airport access. Will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “reasonable price for a reasonable motel”
Reviews.Author: serena3275
Reviews.Content: we stayed here only for 2 nights. rooms are confortable and clean. room service came every morning cleaning, althought I found a bottle of beer in the room which was not mine. las vegas blv is close and you can reach it with 10 dollars drive taxi.

Reviews.Title: “Value for money with short distance to the strip.”
Reviews.Author: FlowerKenzo7
Reviews.Content: Great hotel parallel to the strip. You get a coupon of 10 USD to gamble with next door. No breakfast, however that can be bought next door for reasonable price. Ice cube machine can be very loud when you sleep close by.

Reviews.Title: “Ok for the price”
Reviews.Author: 1AKGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a Monday night, and then two weeks later on a Friday night on my way to and from Utah. On my Monday stay, the bed was hard, I could hear the neighbors tv through the wall and doors slammed constantly. I paid next to nothing though. On my Friday night stay my king bed was comfortable and the place seemed a little more quiet. Friday cost double the price of Monday but I still thought the cost reasonable. Other reviews I've seen complain of the noisy A/C, but at least it drown out the noise of the neighbors!

Reviews.Title: “Renovations at Super 8”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: Got back last week from yet another visit to Super 8 Koval Lane. The place is being "done up" so there is a bit of mess around. The reception area and some of the corridors are looking much brighter. I still think it's about the best budget motel around. The staff are friendly and the rooms are spacious. Free WIFI in all areas of motel. Also free assorted coffees, hot choc etc in lobby.Free transport to and from airport. I will be returning in October and looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “For the price, good value but loud A/C unit”
Reviews.Author: GoodbyeDubai
Reviews.Content: 1 block from strip, next to brewery/casino/restaurant. Great place for a quick nights sleep. FYI-They were remodelling many rooms

Reviews.Title: “Just what you would expect from a Super 8”
Reviews.Author: U B
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Super 8 for two nights at the beginning of our trip as it was cheap and looked close enough to the Strip. You basically get what you pay for, it's cheap & cheerful and in line of what you would expect from a motel chain. The room is large enough for 2 and loads of luggage, the bathroom was reasonably clean. We didn't have problems with bedbugs, but the hotel is noisy so if you want a good night's sleep you better bring your earplugs. The pool is small and not very inviting, if you're interested in lounging by a nice, big pool you better get a room at the MGM (which has an awesome pool area but costs at least twice as much per night, it's worth it though). The walk to the Strip is do-able, about 10 to 15 minutes depending on how fast you walk. In daytime it's pretty hot, there is no shade along the way so be prepared. The area seems to be safe enough to walk at night, although we didn't try that. Overall, I probably won't stay in the Super 8 again but get a room in one of the big casinos on the Strip - they're not that much more expensive and you get much more for you money.

Reviews.Title: “Overnight bed after catching a trans pacific flight.”
Reviews.Author: tigertownbob
Reviews.Content: This was a pretty tired motel. However, the rates were cheap and the casino next door has a 24 hour restaurant. Also they have free pickup and dropoff at the airport. I was just looking for a place to sleep after 17 hours on a plane from SE Asia. I wouldn't stay here for a vacation but it was okay for some clean sheets and hot shower.

Reviews.Title: “Guess it's what you would expect”
Reviews.Author: traveler201047
Reviews.Content: Yes, it is a Super 8..but they could at least clean the carpets and get the mold out of the shower in the bathroom. We were bumped from our flight and put here. Can't believe Delta uses this hotel for their airline staff also. Don't know why anyone would come to Vegas and stay here when there are so many other options very close by. the front desk staff was very accomodating...the accommodations are basic (as I expected). Didn't expect every wall in the hallways to be a different color. The renovated pool looked nice. Casino next door is extremely smokey and very small.

Reviews.Title: “A Nightmare from Hell”
Reviews.Author: unlucky92249
Reviews.Content: Stayed there 3 days. The air condtioner did not work at all. They missed cleaning my room 1 day. When the maid came to clean after I complained, she complained to me that I was making her job difficult like she was the victim. You know just friken clean my room and provide your customers with service!!!!! Maybe she would rather unemployed instead!!!! Also the table was in need of maint. was wobbleing. And...... the lobby COFEE WAS POOR!!!!!! I was not too impressed with the casino next door either. The location is great walking distance to the strip.

Reviews.Title: “Recruit New staff urgently”
Reviews.Author: AlanNorthernireland
Reviews.Content: The old saying you get wot you pay for , Super 8 suits people on a budget and being my 2nd trip in 4 week to vegas did the job for me .Pool closes no carpet on floors smeel in rooms good shower beds disgusting and the location is about 1/2 mile to bellagio on the strip.Use flamingo road and join strip at ballys dont try to get to mgm at night from koval lane NOW heres the problem The staff rude , down rite ignorant , we walked into recepition 1 nite and they were in the middle blocking the area off we stumbled across the floor quickly as not to get trapped and wot a mouthful from the young girl on reception , we decided to say sorry and headed off to our room before we got there security was waiting and asked us to vacate the hotel for intimadating the receptionist wot happened next was frightning the security guys decided to flex his muscles and was prepared to have an actual punch up luckly we talked our way out of it and used the side entrance at ellis island casino for the next few nights . seriously i wouldnt stay here again i travel to vegas for boxing and will not set foot back inside this (wot did someone call it ) a little gem your having a laugh .

Reviews.Title: “super 8, 4250 Koval Lane - take care bed bugs!!”
Reviews.Author: travellingisliving
Reviews.Content: we were surprised by bed bugs in the middle of the night. we decided to leave the motel and the receptionists wondered if we might have brought the bugs! They were not cooperating and were rude, almost annoyed by the fact we told them about bugs. When we asked about not charging my credit card, since we were going to leave the hotel, one receptionist said that she could not do anything about it. Next day we spoke with the general manager, who charged my money back and seemed being understanding about our situation. even if it was cheap, we were happier for paying more and getting a cleaner and safer place!

Reviews.Title: “What a DUMP”
Reviews.Author: Bogota73
Reviews.Content: First and foremost - Be sure to ask about the POOL. The lovely pool pictured in the ad.. is under construction.. So if you want to go swimming.. you are out of luck. Second - 1 block off the strip. 1 block in Las Vegas is 1/2 mile long. So, you would have to walk 1/4 mile to Flamingo road, then 1/2 mile to Las Vegas Blvd. just to get to Ballys. So, that too is worthless information. Our shower was DIRTY. Yuk. The room was never made up while we were out. And! Housekeeping took our towels and never gave us any back (we got some from the front desk) NO Free breakfast like at MOST Super 8's (It does say that in their ad.so not a detraction) This is where the flight crew for SW airlines stay.. And, we felt like MOST of the staff had their own agenda, of which work was not a part. TWO redeeming factors. 1- If you walk up and down the strip all day (Plan on walking 5 miles a day if you are going to see anything) the Mattress will seem comfortable. 2. The coffee machine in the lobby (which also gives Hot Chocolate) is pretty good. Also, If you want to LAUGH look at the posted rate on the door card. $400.00 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel to the Rescue”
Reviews.Author: Pweb44
Reviews.Content: My wife & I booked a room at the Super 8 for our last day in vegas which we had no intention to spend the night, only to give us a place to store our bags and to allow us to freshen up before our scheduled flights home. We spent the previous week in Vegas at a nearby resort but since we had to check out of the resort @ 10 am our last day and our flight was not until 1 am this place offered us a cheap room to fill our needs. We wanted a place to allow us a day to lay by the pool if we wanted but during our stay the pool area was closed for renovation to the desk. Oh well there are plenty of other thinigs to keep us entertained in Vegas. We had breakfast one morning earlier in the week @ Ellis Island and were pleased with the food and atmosphere at the Super 8 that we were glad we booked this place. Upon checking out of the resort nearby, we walked down the street and were able to check in early. The front desk staff were very friendly and checkin was quick and easy. The room is a basic room with bed that was a little on the firm side, TV, chair & table, bathroom and sink area that you find in any standard hotle room. It was clean and bright. After dropping our bags off, we headed over to Ellis Island to get a bit to eat before heading out for a day of fun. The food here is fantastic and very reasonably priced, we loved our meals here both time we ate, where else can you get a Steak & Eggs that had a very good steak for $4.99? The breakfast burrito my wife ordered was huge and could easliy feed 2 people. After spending the day on the strip, we returned to the hotel to get ready for our flight home. We took a shower and finished packing. Around 10:30 we checked out and took the shuttle to the airport provided by the hotel. Here is where Super 8 was able to come to the rescue. Upon checking in at the airport we discovered there was an issue with our flights, something to do with flights not correctly confirmed by our travel provider and then connecting flights being cancelled due to weather. After spending 2 1/2 hours at the airport, we need to spend another night in Vegas while we sorted out our flight issues. My wife called the Super 8 to see if we could check back into the room we paid the for but already had checked out. The gentleman at the front desk, Rich I believe was his name, said it would be no problem, our room was still there and he would send the shuttle over to pick us up. The shuttle arrived at the airport to pick us up as promised and upon returning to the Super 8, they gave us new keys to the same room we had used ealier in the day. After several calls to the airlines' toll free number we were confirmed on new flights for the morning. The shuttle to the airport in the morning went smoothly like it had on the previous times we took advantage of the shuttle. The beds were a little firm and the pillows were a little think for our liking but the hotel is currently under a renovation so I hope this is something they will change when done. I overheard the woman at the front desk explain they were renovating the entire hotel, they were currently doing the common areas and then will work on freshing up the rooms at a later point. I would have no issues using this Super 8 again in the future. They came to the rescue for us when our flights were messed up and the free airport shuttle is great. Next time in Vegas we most likely would use this hotel if we needed accomidations for a night.

Reviews.Title: “WELL WORTH A VISIT”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here on numerous occasions and have always enjoyed it. Sure it's not glitzy like Strip hotels but it's handy for the Strip, it's clean and there's a free pick up and drop off from the airport. Free internet and coffee in the rooms and reception area. Great restaurant in Ellis Island casino next door. Swimming pool is small but OK.

Reviews.Title: “hidden inn caught by surprise!”
Reviews.Author: bai_lao_su
Reviews.Content: our flight was cancelled and due to no flight for that night we had no choice to spend another night at las vegas. this hotel was recommended by the airport staff due to we do not want to spend too much money to additional night stay in vegas. super 8 had an airport picked up van. the check in is quiet fast and the staff even recommended us to take the family room that can accomodate 6 of us due to our budget of having to stay additional night.rooms has basic ammenities hot shower, tv, coffee maker, towels. they even have coffee/ tea 24 hours at the lobby. it only takes app. 10min walk to vegas central attraction. not a bad recommendation by the airport staff.

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE PLACE”
Reviews.Author: dtssjc
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in, it was a horrible experience. We had prepaid for our stay. But it took them an hour to find us in there system. We were there first, but they checked in 30 people who hadn't prepaid before us. We paid for a non-smoking room, they gave us a smoking room, a horrible mix with asthma. We put the do not disturb sign up, they came in anyway. There was pet stains all over the hotel. There were holes in the walls were termites came through. We ordered a queen size bed, we got a double, we could feel the springs coming through on the bed. Will never go here again. The ONLY good thing about this place is the location. However, even with that, there was a bunch of homeless people hanging around the hotel. My husband stated "The world's dummest people work there"

Reviews.Title: “excellent value, and a wise use of your money in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: styx_fire
Reviews.Content: This is a very smart alternative to paying hundreds of dollars to stay on the Strip. This hotel is an easy walk to the strip, and provides everything a traveler needs. Free wi-fi, free airport shuttle, free parking, and they also offer room service (yes they do!) and have snack & bottled-water machines available. No resort fees, no nighttime pool closure, no street noise. Next door is an award-winning Brewery/casino/restaurant with an award-winning players' club. The place is always lively and well-frequented, with slots, gaming tables, and even karaoke. Besides the restaurant, the casino also includes a BBQ place and a pizza/salad place. The rooms are simple (not "elegant", not "swanky", just basic) and they are clean. The beds are firm. There's also a gas station on the other side of the brewery/casino, for anything else you could possibly want. I didn't notice any kind of street noise, and the place seems safe. This hotel is the most logical place to stay in Vegas. I'm a repeat customer.

Reviews.Title: “Great for your wallet...Murder to your Body”
Reviews.Author: Forestfaery
Reviews.Content: Yes the price of this hotel is very cheap but when it comes down to it you expect a good nights sleep out of any hotel. It could not be had in our room the mattress was very out of date and the springs could be felt throughout. The pillows had no life left...we asked for better ones and were told they are all like that...hmmm. We had a dog with us and were therefore forced to stay in a smoking room. The room smelled horrible even when we purchased our own air freshner to spray in the room. Pictures on the website are deceiving and shot from the best angles possible to make this dump look much better then it is. Also do not recommend this as a family spot with the class of people staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the price”
Reviews.Author: jstetson
Reviews.Content: Room and linens very clean. Staff helpful. Price great for the location. Fifteen minute walk to monorail at Baileys. Casino, Brewery and restaurant next door convenient and well priced with great food. The motel is very large, Super 8's largest, yet it only has one elevator which made for a long walk to our room, but if you don't like walking, guess you should not come to Las Vegas. It is also a fifteen minute walk from the MGM parking garage to the jungle restaurant inside the MGM Grand.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD,CONVENIENT AND WELL PRICED.”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: I visit Vegas 4 or 5 times a year and for the last few years I have stayed in the Super 8. If it's your first time in Vegas obviously a Strip hotel would be better for you so you can see all the glitz but if you just want a clean room and a place handy for the Strip this is it. Free pick up and drop off at airport. Coffee and tea supplied in rooms with free WIFI, also free cappuccino,chocolate etc in lobby. Ellis Island casino next door has a great restaurant but sometimes a long wait for a table as the local residents and taxi drivers use it.............that's a good recomendation itself! The swimming pool is quite small but nice and clean. I have never had anything to complain about in this place. The staff are all friendly. Well worth a stay and you're not paying Strip prices for a room.

Reviews.Title: “Not as nice as last year.......”
Reviews.Author: Sparky6654
Reviews.Content: The place is still OK but from our stay last year, you can tell it is being neglected. It wasn't as clean, someone had smoked in the non smoking room. It needed repairs and just is looking run down. On a positive side the help is very friendly and helpful and it is close to the strip. Didn't seem to be as many homeless people hanging around this year either. Still OK for a one night stay I guess and I would still recommend it, at least for now, but it does need some work.

Reviews.Title: “A real good Price to be So Close to the strip”
Reviews.Author: DeweyA
Reviews.Content: It may be a little out dated, but was comfortable, clean as you would expect, and for being basiclly 1 block off the Vegas strip you can't beat the price, and convience. Staff was easy to deal with, pleasurable, and prompt.

Reviews.Title: “Reasonably priced and just steps away”
Reviews.Author: Trailmix44
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended by a friend and I was not disappointed. The pool is open 24 hours so I was sure to utilize it. The rooms are clean and I did not have any problems with noise from other guests. You get casino credits for the adjacent casino, which was small but fun. The wi-fi worked well, but not very fast. I would definitely return to this hotel if I were in Vegas.

Reviews.Title: “OK as a budget hotel near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire_TravelHog
Reviews.Content: Although this is definitely NOT the best hotel in town, it's adequate and just about near enough to the Strip to walk to, plus it has a free airport shuttle. These were our two main requirements. We stayed here last in Sept 2008, it's still the same but I think the lobby area has been re-decorated and the staff seem more helpful and friendly. You get what you pay for, this is a budget hotel but it's OK for a one or two night stay. The restaurant next door at Ellis Island is always busy, again we had a 40 minute wait at 6.45pm.

Reviews.Title: “One of few dog friendly hotels in Vegas”
Reviews.Author: aiar
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were on a road trip with our German Shepherd and Super 8 was one of the few hotels that were pet friendly. We chose this hotel among the rest because of its convenient location (right behind Bally's) near the strip. There was an extra fee for pets per night but the overall price was still decent. The hotel was quite clean other than a few stains along the hallway carpets. The staff was helpful and friendly and the free coffee in the lobby was a plus though a complimentary breakfast would have been nicer. Vending machines were at hand near the lobby with food, drinks and toiletries. There were lots of parking spaces and grassy areas for our dog. Our room was near a side entrance which was convenient for taking our dog in and out without going through the main lobby. We brought a laptop with us and we had access to free WiFi in our room. There was also a computer terminal in the lobby available for a fee. Overall we were quite happy with our 2 night stay and it met our needs. We would stay here again if we ever come to Vegas again with our dog.

Reviews.Title: “dirty and smelly room”
Reviews.Author: BrianChiu
Reviews.Content: cheap, but I wouldn't stay there again, the room was really smelly and dirty, the pool was dirty; location is OK, 5 min walk to the strip, but not the best neighborhood to walk around at night.

Reviews.Title: “It proved ok for us”
Reviews.Author: Jenik
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews we took a gamble on this motel because we knew Koval Lane from the past, and knew we could walk to the Strip. The old saying, " you get what you pay for " is very true, but apart from it being quite basic and having no frills, we were perfectly satisfied. We stayed for three nights at the end of our trip for about $ 40 plus tax per night. Everyone on reception was extremely pleasant and helpful, and we were given a top floor room which we had requested. Even though it was quite close to the vending machines they were no problem. We had two queen beds, the room size was adequate and everything worked. My husband got quite attached to the hole in his blanket. There was no fridge, but we cooled drinks in the ice bucket., The air conditioning unit was typically noisy but we cooled the room right down, and that lasted us most of the night, so we could turn it off. We had temperatures of about 110, so walked the short distance up Flamingo to the back of Bally's, and then escaped the heat by walking through Bally's to the Strip. The Ellis Island casino attached to the hotel appears outdated, but it is extremely popular. The restaurant was very busy, and the special steak ( not on the menu ), you had to ask for it, at $ 7 was superb. Would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value, Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Jamsey
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on numerous occasions and never found anything to complain about. Cheap, clean and cheerful. Rooms are similar in size to some of the larger hotels on Th e Strip. A 5 minute walk through Ballys and Paris takes you on The Strip. Transport is available free to and from airport. Also coffee in rooms and reception area has various coffees free. WIFI is complementary in all rooms. I have always found the staff to be friendly and efficient. I will be returning again next month and looking forward to it.

Reviews.Title: “A decent, reasonably priced place to stay within walking distance of the Strip”
Reviews.Author: JeremiahJ0hns0n
Reviews.Content: I was in Las Vegas for a conference. The conference was headquartered at the Paris Paris and Bally's. The prices there were too high for me so I started looking around the neighborhood. I got a good rate here on the weekdays but the Friday I stayed was a bit steep. Having stayed at Super 8's before I was curious what the world's largest one was like. They really have taken their usual design and blown it up except for the casino and restaurant next door. The rooms were nice and well kept. The hallways were a bit dirty with litter and debris on the floor. The stairways had a strange smell. But once you got to your room it was a peaceful, relaxing, suburban experience in the middle of Las Vegas

Reviews.Title: “Don't Do It”
Reviews.Author: angangang
Reviews.Content: This was my third stay in Las Vegas, and I needed a quick place with good proximity to the airport before starting our National Park trek. I chose the Super 8 because I had eaten the secret $7 steak dinner at the Ellis Island Casino next door and knew that it was within walking distance to the strip for a quick stroll at night. I would NOT stay there again. I am extremely thrifty and wondered how bad the place could actually be. The carpet was ripped everywhere, and the sink faucet handle came off a couple of times when we went to wash our hands. The level of cleanliness (sheets, bathroom, carpet) was questionable. The number of unsavory characters hanging out there made me feel unsafe, and I wondered at one point if this was some type of "men's hotel" for down-and-outers or whatever. That being said, the restaurant next door is one of the few normal restaurants near the Strip: no $60 buffet, but just normal food. We had breakfast there and had no complaints. If anyone is looking for a cheap but convenient place to stay, try your other options: the Imperial Palace, etc. Don't stay here, especially if you are female, have kids, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Worst Super 8 I have ever stayed at!”
Reviews.Author: TheFamilyTravelAgent
Reviews.Content: We normally book stays at Super 8 hotels while traveling because they are usually very clean and kept up in their maintenance and are always at a reasonable price. However, the Super 8 at the Las Vegas strip has to be the WORST Super 8 in the country. We normally don't care about fancy hotels if we need to save some money as long as where we stay is clean with reasonable access, but this place was downright offensive. We went to Vegas with some other family memebers to attend a cousin's wedding, and I was very embarassed to have recommended that we stay at this hotel, which we opted for because each of our traveling parties were traveling with pets, and there are a limited number of hotels that accept pets. The whole time there, I felt compelled to constantly appologize to our relatives for this hotel that I picked out for us to stay at. This hotel was dirty, and falling apart, and the staff didn't care about our problems with our room. I could not receive internet connection as promissed, and the ONLY handicapped ramps into the facility were at the front door on each end of the covered driveway, which were both blocked by either cars parked at the ramps for hours at a thime, and by cast iron benches. My mother, who cannot walk up steps, had to struggle getting past the "road blocks" at the ramps with her motorized scooter to get both in and out of the hotel, and our room was far away from the front enterence. These ramps were the only way for my mother to enter the hotel. The only good thing that I can say about this place is that the hotel casino directly next door has a great restaurant with low prices that we ate at a couple of times and enjoyed. Next time we go to Vegas though, we will definately stay at another hotel. I would NOT recommend this Super 8 hotel to anyone to stay at, even someone I didn't like!

Reviews.Title: “Unplanned visit, adequate but tiny room”
Reviews.Author: al4175
Reviews.Content: Flight was cancelled due to mechanical problems so the airline put us up here. Free shuttle from the airport. Quick and efficient check-in. Room smaller than I'm used to staying in with a small bath. Did have a coffee maker. The adjacent Ellis Island Casino and the restaurants were a nice touch. After dinner decided to stretch my legs and walked past the Platinum (which I'd stayed the previous 5 nights) to the Tuscany. Two homeless guys sleeping on the pebbles between the sidewalk and parking lot at the 7-11 next to Ellis Island on a cold night. What a shame. Adequate for a brief rest prior to departing for the airport EARLY the next morning. I wouldn't consider it for a longer stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best thing about this place is the restaurant next door.”
Reviews.Author: MKUltra3340
Reviews.Content: I stayed here mid December 2009. The tall front desk gentleman was lovely; very personable, and he seemed to enjoy his job. Were it not for him, I I would've rated this place lower. The room was clean, but old and drab, as was the bathroom. It might've been a bit depressing, but I wasn't in the room much so it was okay. More importantly, the sheets were clean and it good condition, as were the towels. The bed and pillows were comfortable. I did experience a few irritations while I was there. The alarm clock in the room was not working. The friendly gentleman at the front desk said someone would be by shortly with a replacement. Also, the chain in the toilet broke, so it wouldn't flush. Luckily one of us is very handy and fixed it. We waited about 30 minutes for the clock, but then had to get something to eat. The clock never arrived, but in the end it wasn't needed because the maid was vacuuming the hallway at 7:30am Saturday morning! Ridiculous. Koval Lane is very close to the strip, but it has a lot of VERY seedy looking apartments and derelict buildings which made me feel a little uneasy as we approached the motel. Our cards wouldn't unlock the door to the hotel which was closest to the casino and restaurant, so we had to walk all the way around it was pretty cold, so that was annoying. Ellis Island is a great restaurant-- you can tell by the line-ups and people's willingness to wait up to an hour for food. The portion size, quality and price are one of the best in Las Vegas. Skip Super 8, but have a meal at Ellis Island.

Reviews.Title: “Easy walk to the strip”
Reviews.Author: Sparky6654
Reviews.Content: Help was very, very friendly and helpful. Extremely quiet for how big it is and how many people staying there. Only stayed 1 night but would stay longer. Got me a parking spot for my Harley right out front were it could be watched.

Reviews.Title: “Ok just to stay”
Reviews.Author: Mrmark21
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fine if you want a place just to crash at night and you are on a budget as we were. They have a shuttle that did bring us back to the airport and took forver to come to the airport. There is the Ellis Island casino next door, and it has inexpensive gaming and food in the restaurant that actually is pretty good. There is a quickie mart about a block away and you can get stuff you need there for cheap. It takes about 10 mins to walk to Bills on the strip. The room at the Super 8 was clean and we had no complaint about the staff or property.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for money at 44 USD for double room”
Reviews.Author: Paul81
Reviews.Content: We had 2 double rooms for 3 nights for a cheap price on offer. I think you can also usually find 40 $ coupons for this hotels on weekdays. The rooms were fine and clean and with coffee in rooms. Also it is nice to able to park near the room. You cant do that at the large Casino hotels. The pool was small but OK for a short swim. Also a not very much used SPA with hot water. Dont think there were any free breakfast but coffee in reception. But there is the very reasonably priced restaurant at the attached Ellis Island Casino next to it. Also a 7-11 next to E I. There are some homeless people and beggars near the hotel but they dont bother you very much. Just say sorry no. You can walk to the strip in 15 minutes or drive in 5 minutes so for me the location was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for the money”
Reviews.Author: 777DayTripper
Reviews.Content: I booked this room through hotels.com because I was told they accept pets and are located near the Strip. I had originally planned to stay at the airport La Quinta, which also accept pets but is not walking distance to the Strip. The reservationist said Super 8 was closer, and had a mid-week special running for $33/night for 3 days so I took it. I've never stayed at a Super 8 and was a little more than leery about the hotel and location. I had no expections whatsoever given the price, but was pleasantly surprised at what $33 bucks could buy. The street doesn't appear to be the safest area especially at night, and has poor street lighting due to large vacant/under construction lots that run along Koval Ln. However, the nearest intersection is so busy with car and foot traffic at all hours that I didn't mind walking to the strip after the sun went down. Just use your common sense. The hotel is 1 (Las Vegas) block from the strip and about a 10 minute walk - or less, if you cut through Ballys at the side entrance. The room was your standard motel room with a flat screen tv, coffee maker, a/c, etc, nothing exceptional. The linens were clean, but I noticed the boxspring/mattress had various stains at the side. I guess as long as the sheets were clean, I didn't need to know or see what was underneath. The hall carpets were stained but my room was clean and okay. I discovered that all 3 icemakers on all 3 floors were broken, which was a disappointment, however, on my 3 day they replaced them with new ice machines. All the hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. I think if you have no unrealistic expections, you wont be disappointed. I mean, you do get what you pay for, and if we all had the $200 to $300+ per night to shell out for the Bellagio--we would, so I have no complaints. It's a good deal if you only want to crash for a few days, and don't intend to spend much time in the room, but just to sleep. The pros are the proximity to the Strip and being able to park your car directly in front of your room. They also have Ellis Island next door, open 24 hours. I didn't eat there, but looked at the menu, which was inexpensive and had the standard Denny's-esque food items. It was fairly busy, and the patrons seemed to be locals.The one con that may be a big deal to some (besides the obvious lack of any semblance of luxury) is the dark unlit street. A couple street lamps couldn't hurt, and the creepiness factor may intimidate some people. There were a few homeless panhandlers hanging out at the corner Arco and at the bus stop across the street, but not unlike the many homeless you see on the Strip asking for money. It's just that seeing a few on a dark desolate street seems more ominous than the ones you see on the busy well-lit Strip. They didn't bother me and I had no problems. It was an overall pleasant stay for a few days and a few bucks.

Reviews.Title: “Ellis Island is the Best Place to Stay in Vegas for the crowd looking to save a few bucks yet party like their in Vegas.”
Reviews.Author: mjvidra
Reviews.Content: They serve $1.50 pints of beer at the Bar all day. It is brewed on site. It isnt the best beer, according to www.beeradvocate.com, but its only $1.50. Also, if you do breakfast, lunch or dinner in there restaruant there will be a bit of a wait (depending on party size), but the food is low priced and good portioned. The best part of Ellis Island is that there is a Sports Betting area. You wont find this as easily at any other Hotel where the price per room near the strip is under $100/night. It was less then $100/night to stay a block from the strip on a SATURDAY! You cant beat that and what else Ellis Island has. Hope everyone enjoys the stay as much as I did.

Reviews.Title: “Budget stay at good location”
Reviews.Author: Shashank_blr
Reviews.Content: Last year I went to Las Vegas with my friends and we booked Super 8 motel for our stay. The main reason for our stay at this hotel was it's distance from Las Vegas Blvd. We used to party till early hours in morning, and its very convenient to walk till motel after that. The room was spacious and clean, even though its not very luxurious... but since we were budget travelers, so we didn't mind any of it. They also have a casino in this hotel, so if you have urge to gamble but you are too tired to go to casinos on Las Vegas strip, you can start here itself. I will recommend this to budget travelers who are looking for party time on Las vegas strip, as this is not for those who wants to spend quality time in hotel room.

Reviews.Title: “For one night, not so bad.”
Reviews.Author: treehugger99
Reviews.Content: We got bumped off our flight, and this is where the airline put us up. We stayed on the 3rd floor, which we heard was recently renovated. I would not want to stay on floors 1-2. It is worth $40, I suppose. I don't usually stay in budget hotels anymore, because they just gross me out personally. However I have stayed in SO MANY of them, I can call myself an expert. This one is just ok, middle of the road. I did not use the shower, but my cousin did and she didn't complain. There is a hot tub outside, but it looked dirty and didn't smell like chlorine. The beds were not comfortable, but not awful. It is located right off the strip, we got to Hard Rock very quickly in a cab. Cabs drive past there all day long. Warning about Airport shuttle - Since this is where the airlines put their crew, you should not count on getting a seat on the shuttle. We were on the shuttle waiting for it to leave, and then when they ran out of seats, they actually told us to get off because we were not flying Southwest (and then the Southwest employees took our seats.) We took a cab which wasn't so bad, pretty close, but still.. would have been nice to use the free shuttle.

Reviews.Title: “Great value near the strip. Nice folks.”
Reviews.Author: crcclu
Reviews.Content: So much easier than strip hotels. Strip is no farther than some of the parking garages just to get to your room. Nice folks & great food at Ellis Island. Cheaper than the strip. Free open internet access was the big plus. Most places around here charge $13 per day. I was on the side near the casino but didn't hear anything. A coffee pot was also nice.

Reviews.Title: “3rd floor is all new”
Reviews.Author: GoFor2009
Reviews.Content: This centrally located hotel is right off the Strip. You can see Planet Hollywood from the front door. They have recently remodeled all the rooms on the 3rd floor. The rooms are small, but clean and nicely decorated in a retro motif. There are flat screen televisions in the newly done rooms and colorful accents done with paint and fabric. Rates are less then $90. Ellis Island next door has several resturants serving steak, BBQ and other value priced meals. Plans for upgrading the other floors are in place.

Reviews.Title: “OK for the price”
Reviews.Author: ravik89
Reviews.Content: We went to Vegas on July 4th weekend. Its hard to find cheap hotels during that time. We decided to try this one out. It was cheap and a free breakfast. Its not a bad hotel for the price considering it was fully booked during that time. The building as such need an upgrade. The rooms were bigger. No refrigerator. It sucks considering the heat outside. The beds were comfortable. The bathrooms were not very clean but not bad. Overall I will recommend this hotel if you want to save money.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night.”
Reviews.Author: jimh316
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were getting into Las Vegas in the afternoon, and leaving the next morning to drive down to the Grand Canyon, so we wanted something cheap and comfortable, which this place is. It was easy to get to from the airport, and they have a courtesy shuttle to and from the airport. The room was a good size, and clean, although it was on the ground floor and faced the road, so there was some noise, but not much. The front desk staff didn't seem to really want to be there, so not much information was forthcoming when asked. I guess you get that in a cheap off the strip motel like this. The motel is about a 10 minute walk from the Strip (too far for some), so it's good value for the location, and there is a restaurant next door, which seemed to be busy when we walked past. There is also a convenience store nearby. Overall, we found that this motel was sufficient for one night, but wouldn't stay for more than that.

Reviews.Title: “Good value for a budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire_TravelHog
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel twice during our USA vacation, on the day of our arrival to the USA and again on the night before our departure. We chose it because it had an airport courtesy shuttle, was within walking distance of the Strip and had a restaurant next door. We weren’t disappointed with our choice although for some people it could be too far to conveniently walk to the Strip. The rooms were well maintained, clean and large and the air conditioning was effective without being too noisy at night. On our second visit we did have a similar problem to another reviewer in that our room key malfunctioned twice and we had to call for the maintenance man to unlock the door. Whilst the rooms were clean the corridors we poorly maintained and could do with new carpets and some fresh paint and brighter lighting. The reception staff were efficient but not as friendly as many other USA reception staff. Remember, this is a budget hotel and therefore don’t expect the luxury of the larger hotels on the Strip. If you just need a room for a night then it’s OK but if you are looking for several nights luxury accommodation in Las Vegas then I’d choose elsewhere. The Ellis Island restaurant/casino next door did a good evening meal and breakfast although be prepared to wait 40-45 mins (at 7.30pm) for an evening meal. The night we went there it was packed but they had an efficient system for turning the tables around and getting people seated. There is also a 7-11 store nearby which makes it easy to stock up with provisions.

Reviews.Title: “Experience Vegas on a tight budget ..try Super 8”
Reviews.Author: sweatshack
Reviews.Content: -This hotel is very basic and definitely suits the budget. - Its about a good 10min walk off the strip to Bally's. -Rooms were small but well air conditioned. -Beds were not that comfortable, halls smelt very muggy and musty and not well lit. - No continental breakfast had a hot beverage dispenser but that was it. - Good free airport shuttle which is very helpful but BOOK night before. - Cabs will not pick you up there they are all on the strip but its about a 5$ cab ride from Bally to Super 8. -Front desk was rude and not that helpful except for the odd person..depends on the time of day. -Room keys never worked always had to get them re programed every time we got back. and were locked out from the pool. -Pool was refreshing after a long hot day but it was small and had a terrible location. -taps in shower were confusing and backwards. - 7-11 is close by and great to run and pick up a quick breakfast or coffee. Overall its great on a tight buget and when you are not spending a whole lot of time at the hotel. However Im not sure if we'd stay there again because I would rather stay on the strip and spend the money for the quality.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: OZLJ
Reviews.Content: Free Airport Shuttle was a nice thing to have when you're flight arrives at midnight. The rooms are big and clean and air conditioned. The air con was too noisy to have on all night though. Friendly, helpful staff. Vending macines on all floors and ice machines. 1 block back from the central strip, 10 minute walk. Ellis Island Casino is next door which had an ok restaurant for breakfast and dinner. 7 11 is next dorr to that. Free WIFI in the rooms Overall good value for money.. only paid about $60 per night for the room. If you're looking for a cheaper alternative and you're happy to stay off the strip, i highly recomend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Motel!”
Reviews.Author: derekUnitedKingdom
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 nights late April. Was delighted with motel, rooms were bigger than usual only thing lacking was fridge, nice heated pool with plenty of spare loungers, airport shuttle very efficient and quick, excellent wireless internet, easy walking to all the major casinos and they even have free cappuccino!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Value”
Reviews.Author: Bob1789
Reviews.Content: Nice folks at the desk. Great room. Maintenance was great. Had a loose faucet knob. Took care of it in minutes. Super price for the two queens we got. The restaurant on site and in the casino was a really great buy and the food was great. Somewhat of await at meal time. They have an unadvertised steak breakfast special for the local cabbies for $4. You can't beat it and I took advantage of it. As a travel agent I was looking for a low price super value for my customers and got it; far superior to the America's Best Value Inn which I stayed in around the corner too.

Reviews.Title: “Just an Average hotel”
Reviews.Author: rachyf
Reviews.Content: Check In was great. We stayed here for 3nights while on a tour to Vegas. I was worried as it wasnt on the Boulvard...Though it is a 10minute walk to Ceasers/Bellagio. It was great. Cheap and cheerful. The best place to go in Vegas when you are on a budget. When we where here, there was alot of army staying in the same hotel so in way we felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Debit Card Fraud”
Reviews.Author: DanijelaDelft
Reviews.Content: We were visiting US from Europe. We were on our way to Grand Canyon and we've decided to spend the night in Las Vegas and continue our trip in the morning. We have arrived around 11pm and asked for a room at the reception for one night. The first thing we were asked for was the credit card and the ID. Ok, yes we were a bit stupid giving the debit card just like that, but I thought he wanted to do kind of 'double check' of the identity... I don't know... I wasn't thinking. So what happens next second is that the guy swipes the card through the reader without saying anything. So we were NOT asked if we would like our credit card to be used! We get to our room and we check the bank account and we see that 600$ more than the price of the room was taken from the account!! We get down to the reception to ask if they took it. The answer was 'no'. But they DID take the money! There was another weird thing about the payment. We were told that the price was 75$, and after the card was used we got something to sign where it was said that we payed 75$. Later we saw 682$ were taken. When we asked the thief how much he took he said he took only 82$ which is for 'security reasons' and he will put back 7$ tomorrow if everything is ok with the room. But in the morning some other person at the reception said that 82$ was 75$ + tax! So we got a 'receipt' from the thief saying 75$, but they officially took 82@ but what they really did is that they took 682$! We got the money back from the bank, but I wouldn't recommend going to that place. For the rest, the room was nice and clean. But I guess that is what is always expected.

Reviews.Title: “Return to Super 8”
Reviews.Author: BHP1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here back in 1994 and returned again in Jan because the weekend rate of $80 was the best I could find. The property is a bit older now but still worth the price. The Ellis Island casino is exactly as I remember it and this time I even brought the wife along. It's a bit of a walk out to the strip but hey who doesn't need the exercise! Overall no problems at the Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good and Basic”
Reviews.Author: jarvol
Reviews.Content: Hotel has a great location behind Ballys which is about a 10 minute walk to the strip. The amenities are basic but clean and suitable if you are only wanting a room to catch 5 or 6 hours of sleep and take a shower. They also have a free shuttle to and from the airport. They also let me check-in a few hours early. It is a Super 8 and I paid $60 inclusive for a room 10 minutes from the strip. If you want a Bellagio experience then pay for it. The real deal whether you stay here or not is to take advantage of Ellis Island next door. They have $4.95 steak dinner and give you a $5 match play. They also have a microbrew, good pizza, and a small casino with cheap tables.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if you're after a cheap hotel in a central location”
Reviews.Author: mrspink
Reviews.Content: This motel was absolutely fine for the price. It's in a great location, just one block back from the strip and there's a free airport shuttle. If you're staying for a while and can get a good deal at a better hotel on the strip, go for it. But, if like us, it's just a bed for the night then it's fine. The lady that drove the shuttle to take us to the airport was really friendly and the free coffee machine in reception was welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Does the Trick”
Reviews.Author: Two-PS-Mikes
Reviews.Content: The Super 8 in Las Vegas works for us because it is an uncomplicated experience and, in Las Vegas, hotels typically are absurdly complicated. The room is very average -- a queen-sized bed that is adequately comfortable, reasonable space in the bathroom, and a room size that, while not spacious, is also not cramped. Some positives included WiFi service that was lightning fast and a casino next door that serves somes darn good microbrews. The big factor that leads us here when we are staying in Vegas is that we can get to our hotel room in under five minutes. At the big Vegas casino/hotels, you will spend at least 20 minutes walking from your car to your hotel room and typically more. If you are passing through Vegas (as we were) or you do not want to deal with the complications that are par for the course in big Vegas hotels, the Super 8 might provide a good alternative.

Reviews.Title: “Great motel!”
Reviews.Author: hazelrain
Reviews.Content: If you vacation for the hotel amenities, maybe this isn't for you. I, however, loved it. This Super 8 is right off the Strip - it took me 11 minutes to walk to the Flamingo Hotel, where my convention was. It's a $5.00 cab ride with tip (unless traffic is bad). So all the hotels, restaurants and attractions are right nearby. There is a pool but I didn't use it. It's not a luxury pool, but it could be fun for a family to play in. The restauarnt next door, Ellis Island (I think) was highly recommended by the locals (cab drivers) for great, cheap steak and has a bar and small casino. There is a 7/11 on the corner for odds & ends. Free wireless internet in the lobby, which is roomy and comfortable. Coffee available 24/7 and individual coffee makers in the rooms. Great, helpful friendly staff. Airport shuttle. Air conditioning works well. Plenty of towels. Bathrooms large enough and clean, with fantastic water pressure. I had no complaints at all and can't imagine why you'd spend more. At $55 for a single room, it's less than half of most hotels in Vegas!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room and shower”
Reviews.Author: creole49
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Super 8 while attending our sons graduation from UNLV. We are from West Lafayette, IN and though we have visited Las Vegas several times over the past years we have always stayed on the strip. This year we wanted something close to the strip, but not in the middle of the hussle and bussle. The Super 8 was wonderful. The rooms were large, clean, and well maintained. The shower was great and the hot water seemed endless. I will also speak on the friendliness of the staff and front desk people. Great experience and I intend to go out next year 2008 in March for another celebration and stay at the Super 8. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Rocky Horror Picture Show at Super 8”
Reviews.Author: CanadianBoys
Reviews.Content: Stayed 1 night May 2007, selecting Super 8 Koval Lane based on some reviews on TA and I was desperate. I needed ease of access to the strip for some meetings – and had a place on the strip for the other nights booked – but could not get the first night because of a major conference being held in LV. I called the Super 8 but they told me they would only make a room available on the weekend if I booked 2 nights – so I kept searching and lo and behold, Travelworm had 1 night available at the same Super 8 so I booked it on Travelworm. I arrived early, left my bags and was told my room should be ready by noon. It was not – in fact, it was not ready until 4 pm. I was eventually given a room with queen bed for a price of $139.00 per night plus tax – prepaid on Travelworm. That was a steal for the weekend I was there! The room was basic and clean. Toiletries were of a low-end motel quality. The motel seemed to attract some “interesting” guests – like the woman who slept for hours outside my door early in the evening, then woke up and called someone on her cell. Same woman was thrown out of the motel at about 2 am; she was outside my door again pounding on the door across the hall screaming. Security told her that her husband had checked out early that day and she had to get out and she would not go as she had no money and no where to go. Needless this made an interesting one night stay – my first and last at this Super 8.

Reviews.Title: “Well situated Motel”
Reviews.Author: Brambletye
Reviews.Content: We chose this motel for it's position and low price - and we weren't disappointed. For an 'off strip' motel it is in an excellent position - just a 5-10 minute walk to the centre of The Strip (Bellagio, Caesars, Bally's & Flamingo). It was clean and comfortable and certainly good value. If you're just looking for somewhere to stay without any frills, then I would definitely recommend staying here. Don't miss the fountains at Bellagio!

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: melann26
Reviews.Content: We were expecting something bad - but it turned out to be okay. I mean - It is a motel so you can't expect too much. But we were on a budget - so we thought about money instead of comfort. But it was located 5 mins walk from the strip - which was very convenient. And there is complimentary tea/coffee 24/7. But there is no free breakfast in the morning as it says on the sight - this is an error made by Super 8. The rooms are fairly spacious - but very basic. But we got a good deal and were happy with the place. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel at half the price”
Reviews.Author: coconut2
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Super 8 Motel when i was on holiday with Trek America. It was written in our itenary as a Budget hotel so i wasn't expecting much at all. I was pleasantly surprised. The room was spacious, not far to walk to the main strip and the staff were friendly. I would definately stay here again and would recommend it to anyone wanting to stay in Vegas but not able to pay Bellagio prices!!

Reviews.Title: “Great value 'no frills' really near the Strip”
Reviews.Author: HackneyDavid
Reviews.Content: If you want somewhere good value, clean, comfortable and safe with polite helpful staff near the Strip, I would recommend this hotel although it's not for those who want fluffy white bathrobes in their rooms and the other frills you get if you pay more. I stayed here for a family wedding. The rest of my family were in the Luxor/Bellagio and I was glad I had decided to stay somewhere smaller/cheaper which did not entail a six mile walk from the hotel lobby to the room which is the case with those big Vegas hotels. (I reckon I was on the strip in not much less time than it owuld have taken me to get down there from a room at the Bellagio once you had taken into the account the lengthy corridors, waiting for elevators etc etc). check-in was fast and easy with no queues, they had internet access (expensive but good that it was available) and free coffee in the lobby (be warned, Las Vegas hotels don't seem to supply the tea and coffe making facilities beloved of English hotels). An added bonus is the very blue-collar small Ellis Island Casino which is apparently where the locals go to gamble. They make their own beer, the steaks are meant to be great value (although I never got to try one). Being an Englishman in Las Vegas, I also quite liked being near 'real' things like the local 7-11 which meant I could buy bottled water and food etc as pretty good value (such places exist on the strip but are relatively few and far between). I felt pretty safe walking around this area even late at night although you do see the occasional signs that you are away from the wealth of the Strip - eg poor crazy people yelling at traffic, mumbling to themselves etc. On a general note re Las Vegas, it's amazing how long it can take to walk from one hotel to another even though they appear quite close on the Map which might be worth bearing in mind if you are working out where to stay. The 301 and 302 (Express) buses which run up and down he strip are relatively fast and easy to use - although they can get crowded and you need to make sure you have the correct change before getting on... (2 dollars a ride on the 301 or 5 dollars for an all day pass, and I think 3 dollars on the 302).
